alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 14 at 7:23PM EDT until October 15 at 12:33AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and west central Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln and Waldo. In west central Maine, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Augusta, Waterville, Fairfield, Gardiner, Oakland, Skowhegan, Pittsfield, Wiscasset, Madison, and China. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
